awd_abstract_narration: Developing force by applying pressure to a closed container is a                simple enough concept; controlling the pressure and flow so that                the point of application of the force is constrained to move                    exactly as desired requires a comprehensive knowledge of fluid                  mechanics and automatic control theory.  The study of fluid-power               has become an essential part of the training of agricultural,                   aerospace, industrial and mechanical engineers.  Fluid-power                    devices may be found in equipment ranging from a garden tractor                 to a flight simulator.  A sequence of fluid-power experiments                   starting with basic fluid properties and culminating in the                     control of linear and rotary actuators is provided to the                       student.  Some fluid-power controls are capable of very rapid                   response and instrumentation must tract this response.  The new                 instrumentation will be capable of measuring flows, pressure, and               displacements at intervals of 1/1000 or less.  The fluid power                  industry routinely uses microcomputer based instrumentation and                 it is essential that an engineering student should appreciate the               capability of such instrumentation.
org_div_long_name: Division of Engineering Education and Centers
